abstract: Study published in The Journal of Medical Internet Research: Public Health and Surveillance finds over quarter of homosexual and bisexual men in Southern states have contracted HIV, far higher rare than rest of country; highlights need to allocate resources towards addressing spread of virus.
lead_paragraph: More than a quarter of gay and bisexual men in some Southern cities and states have H.I.V., according to the study, and medical services are lacking.

headline.main: H.I.V. Rates Among Gay Men Are Higher in South, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: High H.I.V. Rates Are Found in South, and Services Lag

snippet: More than a quarter of gay and bisexual men in some Southern cities and states have H.I.V., according to the study, and medical services are lacking.
